result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jaiden L. Purnell in court, in custody.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Jaiden L. Purnell.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:02 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for sentencing after revocation on 20CF171 & 20CF508, with 22CF318 on for arraignment. Record by Atty. Pruden as to agreement of the parties. State confirms agremeent.
ON 20CF171 -
Two (2) years of initial confinement
Six (6) years Extended Supervision
conditions same as probation 
ON 20CF508 - 
Two (2) years of initial confinement
Three (3) years of Extended Supervision
Concurrent with 20CF171 with same conditions.
357 days of dead time credit
Defendant reads statement to the Court.

AS TO 22CF318 - Atty. Pruden waives reading of information, enters not guilty plea(s) and demands speedy trial at this time. Atty. requests status in about 30 days before setting for trial. Court sets as requested.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:04 PM (64-06) Defendant Jaiden L. Purnell appeared by video.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Jaiden L. Purnell.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

State requesting 30 days for Arraignment Hearing.

Adj. 2:07PM
Arraignment scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Further proceedings on September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant in court in custody via video with attoreny Larry Pruden. ADA Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Prelim requested, time period waived. Minutes filed.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jaiden L. Purnell in court, in custody by video. Attorney Renner appeared. SPD still trying to appoint. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jaiden L. Purnell in court, in custody by video. Attorney Hagerman appears specially. SPD requesting more time to appoint attorney. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jaiden L. Purnell in court, in custody by video. James Sempf for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court.  Complaint read by court. Defendant states he qualifies for SPD but they need time to appoint. Minutes filed.

Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
